battlecode.common
Interface RobotController

public interface RobotController

A RobotController allows contestants to make their robot sense and interact with the game world. When a contestant's RobotPlayer is constructed, it is passed an instance of RobotController that controls the newly created robot.

Author:
Teh Devs

Method Detail

canAttackAir

boolean canAttackAir()
Tells whether this robot can attack air units.

Returns:
true if this robot can attack air units, false otherwise

canAttackGround

boolean canAttackGround()
Tells whether this robot can attack ground units.

Returns:
true if this robot can attack ground units, false otherwise

canAttackSquare

boolean canAttackSquare(MapLocation targetLoc)
Tells whether the given square is within range of this robot's attack. Takes into account only the range of the attacking robot, and not whether the robot is currently active or otherwise incapable of attacking. targetLoc cannot be null.

Returns:
true if targetLoc is within attack range of this robot

canMove

boolean canMove(Direction dir)
Tells whether this robot can move in the given direction. Takes into account only the map terrain and positions of other robots. Does not take into account whether this robot is currently active or otherwise incapable of moving. dir cannot be null.

Returns:
true if there are no robots or walls preventing this robot from moving in the given direction; false otherwise

canSpawn

boolean canSpawn()
Tells whether this robot is in the spawn radius of an allied tower. Does not take into account whether this robot is currently active or otherwise incapable of moving or barriers preventing the robot from spawning.

Returns:
true if this robot is an archon in the spawn radius of at least one allied tower; false otherwise

canSenseObject

boolean canSenseObject(GameObject obj)
                       throws GameActionException
Tells whether this robot can currently sense the given GameObject (i.e., whether the given GameObject is in this robot's sensor range).

Returns:
true if this robot can currently sense the given GameObject; false otherwise
Throws:
GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • obj is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)

    double getEventualEnergonLevel()
    Gets the eventual energon level (i.e., taking into account pending transfers) of this robot.

    Returns:
    Math.min(energonLevel + energonReserve, maxEnergon)

    Returns:

    getAllMessages

    Message[] getAllMessages()
    Retrieves an array of all the messages in your incoming message queue. All messages will be removed from the queue. If there are no messages in the queue, this method returns a zero-length array.

    Returns:
    all the Messages in your message queue

    the number of rounds until this robot is attack idle

    transferEnergon

    void transferEnergon(double amount,
                     MapLocation loc,
                     RobotLevel level)
                     throws GameActionException
    Transfers the specified amount of energon to the robot at location loc and RobotLevel height. The robot receiving the transfer must be adjacent to or in the same location as the robot giving the transfer. Robots may not transfer more energon than they currently have. If the transfer would put the receiving robot's energon reserve above ENERGON_RESERVE_SIZE, then its new energon reserve level will be equal to ENERGON_RESERVE_SIZE, and the excess energon will be lost.

    Parameters:
    amount - the amount of energon to transfer to the specified robot
    loc - the MapLocation of the robot to transfer to
    level - the RobotLevel of the robot to transfer to
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • amount is NaN, NEGATIVE_INFINITY, or POSITIVE_INFINITY (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_ENOUGH_ENERGON)
  • The specified square is not adjacent to or the same as this robot's location (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_TRANSFER_ENERGON_THERE)
  • There is no robot at the specified location and height (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_TRANSFER_ENERGON_THERE)
  • This robot does not have amount energon, or amount is negative (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_ENOUGH_ENERGON)

    • clearAction

    void clearAction()
    Removes the action in the action queue. If an action is currently in progress (e.g., the robot is currently moving), that action will not be stopped.

    hasActionSet

    boolean hasActionSet()
    Returns whether this robot has an action already queued in this round.

    Returns:
    true if and only if this robot has an action queued in the current round already.

    attackAir

    void attackAir(MapLocation targetLoc)
               throws GameActionException
    Queues an air attack on the specified location to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. If there is a Robot in the air in the given location when this action is executed, it will feel some damage.

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • This robot is not within attack range of loc (GameActionExceptionType.OUT_OF_ATTACK_RANGE)
  • This robot cannot attack ground (GameActionExceptionType.OUT_OF_ATTACK_RANGE)
  • Attack has not sufficiently cooled down yet (GameActionExceptionType.INSUFFICIENT_ATTACK_COOLDOWN)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Parameters:
    targetLoc - the location of the square you are attacking; cannot be null
    Throws:
    GameActionException

    attackGround

    void attackGround(MapLocation targetLoc)
                  throws GameActionException
    Queues a ground attack on the specified location to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. If there is a Robot on the ground in the given location when this action is executed, it will feel some damage.

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • This robot is not within attack range of loc (GameActionExceptionType.OUT_OF_ATTACK_RANGE)
  • This robot cannot attack ground (GameActionExceptionType.OUT_OF_ATTACK_RANGE)
  • Attack has not sufficiently cooled down yet (GameActionExceptionType.INSUFFICIENT_ATTACK_COOLDOWN)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Parameters:
    targetLoc - the location of the square you are attacking; cannot be null
    Throws:
    GameActionException

    broadcast

    void broadcast(Message msg)
               throws GameActionException
    Adds a message for your robot to broadcast. At the end of your robot's execution block, if a broadcast has been set, the message is removed and immediately added to the incoming message queues of all robots in your broadcast range (except for the sending robot). Note that robots are thus limited to sending at most one message per round.

    You are charged a small amount of energon for every message that you broadcast. The cost of sending a message is equal to (GameConstants.BROADCAST_FIXED_COST + GameConstants.BROADCAST_COST_PER_BYTE*sizeBytes) where sizeBytes is the size of the message, in bytes.

    Each robot can only have one message to broadcast in a given round at a time. Attempts to queue two messages on a robot in the same round will cause the robot to throw a GameActionException with GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR

    Parameters:
    msg - the message you want to broadcast; cannot be null.
    Throws:
    GameActionException - with GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR if this robot already has a message queued in the current round.

    clearBroadcast

    void clearBroadcast()
    Clears any pending broadcast message for this robot.

    hasBroadcastMessage

    boolean hasBroadcastMessage()
    Returns whether your robot has a message queued for the end of this round.

    Returns:
    true if and only if there is a message queued for the end of this round.

    getBroadcastCost

    double getBroadcastCost()
    Gives the cost, in energon, of broadcasting the current set message.

    Returns:
    the cost of broadcasting the current set message

    moveForward

    void moveForward()
                 throws GameActionException
    Queues a forward movement to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. When this action is executed, the robot will attempt to move forward one square in its current direction. If the move succeeds, this robot's new location will immediately change to the destination square, but this robot will be engaged in the ActionType.MOVING action for some number of rounds (defined in this robot's RobotType).

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • The destination terrain is not traversable by this robot (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_MOVE_THERE)
  • The destination square is occupied by another GameObject at the same height (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_MOVE_THERE)
  • Movement has not sufficiently cooled down yet (GameActionExceptionType.INSUFFICIENT_MOVEMENT_COOLDOWN)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Throws:
    GameActionException

    moveBackward

    void moveBackward()
                  throws GameActionException
    Queues a backward movement to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. Moving backward does not change this robot's direction.

    Throws:
    GameActionException
    See Also:
    moveForward()

    setDirection

    void setDirection(Direction dir)
                  throws GameActionException
    Queues a direction change to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. When the action is executed, the robot will change its Direction to the given one. This action has a duration of 1 round.

    Note that the robot can only queue an action once per round. Attempting to queue more than one in a given round will result in a GameActionException with GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR.

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • Movement has not sufficiently cooled down yet (GameActionExceptionType.INSUFFICIENT_MOVEMENT_COOLDOWN)
  • dir is a non-direction direction, i.e. NONE or OMNI (GameActionExceptionType.BAD_DIRECTION)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Parameters:
    dir - the Direction the robot should face; cannot be null
    Throws:
    GameActionException

    spawn

    void spawn(RobotType type)
           throws GameActionException
    Queues a spawn action to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. When the action is executed, a new robot will be created directly in front of this robot. The square directly in front of you must be empty, i.e., a robot of the new type must be able to move into that square from the parent robot's location. The new robot is created and starts executing bytecodes immediately, but parent and child will be engaged in ActionType.SPAWNING and ActionType.WAKING, respectively, for some number of rounds.

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • Tried to spawn with a non-archon unit (GameActionExceptionType.ARCHONS_ONLY)
  • The given robot type cannot be spawned, e.g., it is an evolved unit type (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SPAWN_THAT)
  • You do not have enough energon to spawn the given robot type (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_ENOUGH_ENERGON)
  • You could not move into the square in front of you, if you were a robot of type type (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SPAWN_THERE)
  • You are not in the spawn radius of one of your own towers (GameActionExceptionType.OUTSIDE_SPAWN_RADIUS)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Parameters:
    type - the type of robot to spawn in the square directly in front of you; cannot be null.
    Throws:
    GameActionException

    evolve

    void evolve(RobotType type)
            throws GameActionException
    Queues an evolution action to be performed at the end of this robot's turn. When this action is executed, this robot evolves into a different robot type. The change takes place instantly, but this robot will be engaged in ActionType.EVOLVING for some number of rounds.

    When the action is queued a GameActionException may result. The possible GameActionExceptionTypes are as follows. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.

  • This unit's current robot type precludes it from evolving into the given robot type (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_EVOLVE_INTO_THAT)
  • This robot does not have enough energon to evolve into the given robot type (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_ENOUGH_ENERGON)
  • An action has already been queued in this round (GameActionExceptionType.DOUBLE_ACTION_ERROR)

    • Parameters:
    type - the type of robot to evolve into; cannot be null.
    Throws:
    GameActionException

    yield

    void yield()
    Ends the current round and gives your robot a slight energon bonus, given by GameConstants.YIELD_BONUS * energonUpkeep * (fraction of unused bytecodes in the round). Never fails.

    suicide

    void suicide()
    Kills your robot and ends the current round. Never fails.

    senseAirRobotAtLocation

    Robot senseAirRobotAtLocation(MapLocation loc)
                              throws GameActionException
    Sense any Robots IN THE AIR at this location.

    Parameters:
    loc - the location of the square you are sensing; cannot be null
    Returns:
    the Robot at this location IN THE AIR, or null if there is none.
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • You are not within sensor range of loc (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)

    • senseGroundRobotAtLocation

    Robot senseGroundRobotAtLocation(MapLocation loc)
                                 throws GameActionException
    Sense any Robots ON THE GROUND at this location.

    Parameters:
    loc - the location of the square you are sensing; cannot be null
    Returns:
    the Robot at this location ON THE GROUND, or null if there is none.
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • You are not within sensor range of loc (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)

    • senseNearbyAirRobots

    Robot[] senseNearbyAirRobots()
    Get an array of all Robots IN THE AIR in your current sensor range, excepting the calling robot. The order of the objects returned is undefined. If there are no other objects in your sensor range, a zero-length array is returned.

    Returns:
    array of Robot objects in the air within sensor range, except for the calling robot

    senseNearbyGroundRobots

    Robot[] senseNearbyGroundRobots()
    Get an array of all Robots ON THE GROUND in your current sensor range, excepting for the calling robot. The order of the objects returned is undefined. If there are no other objects in your sensor range, a zero-length array is returned.

    Returns:
    array of all Robot objects on the ground within sensor range, except for the calling robot

    senseTerrainTile

    TerrainTile senseTerrainTile(MapLocation loc)
    Sense the terrain tile at a given MapLocation. If the given location is or has ever been within sensor range of this robot, this method gives the terrain at that location, as described in TerrainTile. If the given location has never been within sensor range of this robot, this method returns null.

    Returns:
    the terrain at the given location, if the robot has seen that location; null otherwise

    senseTowerAngerAtTeam

    double senseTowerAngerAtTeam(Robot tower,
                             Team team)
                             throws GameActionException
    Senses the anger level of the Robot tower at Team team.

    Returns:
    the anger level of a tower at a team
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • Robot tower is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot tower no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
  • Robot tower is not a tower robot (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_A_TOWER)

    • senseTowerAngerAtRobot

    double senseTowerAngerAtRobot(Robot tower,
                              Robot r)
                              throws GameActionException
    Senses the anger level of the Robot tower at Robot r.

    Returns:
    the anger level of a tower at a specfic robot
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • Robot tower is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot tower no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
  • Robot tower is not a tower robot (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_A_TOWER)
  • Robot r is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot r no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)

    • senseTowerSpawnRadius

    double senseTowerSpawnRadius(Robot tower)
                             throws GameActionException
    Senses the spawn radius of the Robot tower.

    Returns:
    the spawn radius of the Robot tower
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • Robot tower is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot tower no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
  • Robot tower is not a tower robot (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_A_TOWER)

    • senseRoundsToTowerWake

    int senseRoundsToTowerWake(Robot tower)
                           throws GameActionException
    Senses the number of rounds until the Robot tower wakes. Returns 0 if Tower is already awake.

    Returns:
    the number of rounds until the Robot tower wakes
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • Robot tower is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot tower no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
  • Robot tower is not a tower robot (GameActionExceptionType.NOT_A_TOWER)

    • senseEnemyArchon

    Direction senseEnemyArchon()
    Returns the approximate direction to the nearest enemy archon, i.e., the direction whose angle is closest to the angle to the nearest enemy archon. If two or more archons are tied for closest, this method returns the approximate direction to one of the closest archons. If there is an enemy archon in the same square as the calling robot, this method returns Direction.OMNI. If there is no enemy archon on the map, this method returns Direction.NONE.

    Returns:
    the approximate direction to the nearest enemy archon

    senseAlliedArchons

    MapLocation[] senseAlliedArchons()
    Returns the locations of all the archons on the calling robot's team. The length of the returned array is equal to the number of allied archons on the map. The order of archons in the returned array is the same between different calls to this method.

    Returns:
    the locations of all the allied archons

    senseClosestUnknownTower

    Direction senseClosestUnknownTower()
    Returns the approximate direction to the nearest tower that you don't own, i.e., the direction whose angle is closest to the angle to that tower. If two or more towers are tied for closest, this method returns the approximate direction to one of the closest towers. If there is an unknown tower in the same square as the calling robot, this method returns Direction.OMNI. If there is no unknown tower on the map, this method returns Direction.NONE.

    Returns:
    the approximate direction to the nearest tower not owned by your team

    senseAlliedTowers

    MapLocation[] senseAlliedTowers()
    Returns the locations of all the towers on the calling robot's team. The length of the returned array is equal to the number of allied towers on the map. The order of towers in the returned array is the same between different calls to this method.

    Returns:
    the locations of all the allied towers

    setIndicatorString

    void setIndicatorString(int stringIndex,
                        java.lang.String newString)
    Sets one of this robot's 'indicator strings' for debugging purposes. These strings are displayed in the client. This method has no affect on gameplay (aside from the number of bytecodes executed to call this method).

    Parameters:
    stringIndex - the index of the indicator string to set. Must satisfy stringIndex >= 0 && stringIndex < GameConstants.NUMBER_OF_INDICATOR_STRINGS
    newString - the value to which the indicator string should be set

    getControlBits

    long getControlBits()
    Gets this robot's 'control bits' for debugging purposes. These bits can be set manually by the user, so a robot can respond to them.

    Returns:
    this robot's control bits

    setArchonMemory

    void setArchonMemory(long memory)
                     throws GameActionException
    Sets this robot's "memory", which is saved for the next game in the match. This method can only be called by an archon. If this method is called more than once in a game, the last call is what is saved for the next game.

    Parameters:
    memory - the data that this archon should remember for the next game
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • The calling robot is not an archon (GameActionExceptionType.ARCHONS_ONLY)

    • getOldArchonMemory

    long[] getOldArchonMemory()
    Returns the archon memory from the archons in the last game of the match. The return value is an array of length 8. If an archon did not call setArchonMemory in the last game, or there was no last game, the corresponding long defaults to 0.

    Returns:
    the archon memory from the archons in the last game of the match

    breakpoint

    void breakpoint()
    If breakpoints are enabled, calling this method causes the game engine to pause execution at the end of this round, until the user decides to resume execution.

    senseRobotInfo

    RobotInfo senseRobotInfo(Robot r)
                         throws GameActionException
    Senses basic information about a given Robot if it is within sensor range.

    Parameters:
    r - Robot to sense information about
    Returns:
    RobotInfo of the Robot r
    Throws:
    GameActionException - under any of the following circumstances. If more than one of the following applies, the GameActionExceptionType will be the first applicable one in the list.
  • Robot r is not a valid GameObject (GameActionExceptionType.INVALID_OBJECT)
  • Robot r no longer exists (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
  • You are not within sensor range of Robot r (GameActionExceptionType.CANT_SENSE_THAT)
    • See Also:
    RobotInfo
